intro: Ternatea polystachya, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, or white. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
